intro: Sloanea zuliaensis, commonly known as the Zulia sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, specifically found in Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
